Talk on Sept 7, 2015, on "Dealing with the heterogeneity of life for comparative methods" to the [EEB interdisciplinary program](http://eeb.tamu.edu) at Texas A&M; my hosts were [Michelle Lawing](http://people.tamu.edu/~alawing/) and [Claudio Casola](http://agrilife.org/casolalab/).
Work highlighted included Brownie, OUwie, hisse, FaMUSSE, and corhmm.
The relevant papers can be seen at [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=vpjEkQwAAAAJ&hl=en).
